Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/24.8.176.213|24.8.176.213]] ([[User talk:24.8.176.213|talk]]) to last version by Rjensen
Unfortunately for your argument Hitler admired much more than Ford's car making.
/* Early life */
/* Allegations of anti-Semitism and ''The Dearborn Independent'' */ tidied per talk
Hitler's role
enough already. This is properly sourced, your stuff is dubious and non-specific
Curcio book = not reliable source; he did no research and relies on popular bio by Lacey instead of scholarship listed here
restoring properly sourced and relevant content *again*. Please stop this whitewashing
/* Allegations of anti-Semitism and ''The Dearborn Independent'' */ Hitler admired Ford's automobiles -- model for Volkswagen; cut the heavy-handed repetition
restore properly sourced content - let's not start up the whitewashing again, it was embarassing last time
version is full of POV -- Liebold for example was an American
rv POV; current wording is correct
cur pov and duplication; magazine was not violent
/* Allegations of anti-Semitism and ''The Dearborn Independent'' */
/* Allegations of anti-Semitism and ''The Dearborn Independent'' */
rv whitewashing; Gerald L.K. Smith was an anti-Semite'; that is why it is important; rev POV reference to medal
tweaks; using short form of refs given in bibliog
I assume that Smith meant that Ford showed no regret for the Independent. Made direct reference for Nolan and moved Nazi award to appropriate place.
/* The Model T */ fixed cite error
restored image. There was a big stink about this award - and Ford pointedly refused to return it. He earned it, he kept it, it deserves a place in his legacy and this article. It was Ford's choice.
Ford never wore the cross and its picture makes for an ugly article--need some car pictures instead
/* Ford Motor Company */ $5 details
took out an extra word in the first paragraph (typo)
/* Quotations */
Raised: November 28,1894 Palestine Lodge No. 357, Detroit, MI Member: Zion Lodge No. 1

expand +ref

corrected caption
expand summary (and drop details of museum)
image formatted so the caption is readable
more details in summary (and less about museums after he died)
/* Allegations of anti-Semitism and ''The Dearborn Independent'' */ keep cross in perspective
There are many types of journalists out there of various calibers. This one is of the "investigational" sort with books on Kurt Cobain and Elivs. Re-added image. It's an excellent illustration.
drop POV on Wallace
Reverted to last by Rj. Let's try to keep this scholarly and leave the "investigative journalists" out of this.
not necessary -- source is in cite

adding Wallace quote
fixed italics
expanded + refs

page numbers for those who have books without an index
editors need to read one serious book before they start at work on a major article
editors need to read one serious book before they start at work on a major article
substituting better quote
this is the last time I expect to have to do this. when asked for a citation, you *must* provide a proper one. You cannot tell people to "go look it up". Please abide by policy.
Watts book has a good index and it is easy to use.
